pullRequest.body:
Part of #15524. This adds basic definitions for the `coheight`, and then
analogous lemmas for every lemma about `height`. Due to the way
`coheight` is defined, most lemmas are defeq to the corresponding lemma
bout `height` in the dual order.

From the Carleson project.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma height_toDual (x : Î±) : height (toDual x) = coheight x := rfl
@[simp] lemma height_ofDual (x : Î±áµ’áµˆ) : height (ofDual x) = coheight x := rfl
@[simp] lemma coheight_toDual (x : Î±) : coheight (toDual x) = height x := rfl
@[simp] lemma coheight_ofDual (x : Î±áµ’áµˆ) : coheight (ofDual x) = height x := rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_anti : Antitone (Î± := Î±) coheight :=
```

```suggestion
  height_mono.dual_left
```
might work

Unfortunately doesnâ€™t:
```
synthesized type class instance is not definitionally equal to expression inferred by typing rules, synthesized
  instâœ
inferred
  OrderDual.instPreorder Î±
```
And instantiating `Î±` gives
```
type mismatch
  Monotone.dual_left height_mono
has type
  Antitone (height âˆ˜ â‡‘OrderDual.ofDual) : Prop
but is expected to have type
  Antitone coheight : Prop
```
which doesnâ€™t seem to line up, not sure why exactly.

Is it DefEq abuse to just use `a` at type `Î±áµ’áµˆ`, as in the definition of
```
noncomputable def coheight {Î± : Type*} [Preorder Î±] (a : Î±) : â„•âˆž := height (Î± := Î±áµ’áµˆ) a
```

> And instantiating `Î±` gives

Do you mean
```
height_mono (Î± := Î±).dual_left
```
? because the right thing would be
```
height_mono (Î± := Î±áµ’áµˆ).dual_left
```
Ah, yes, that may explain my failure. I'll try!

```suggestion
lemma length_le_coheight_head {p : LTSeries Î±} : p.length â‰¤ coheight p.head :=
```
... unless I've lost my last, hmm head
No, certainly my mind that got lost at some point here :-)

```suggestion
lemma rev_index_le_coheight (p : LTSeries Î±) (i : Fin (p.length + 1)) : i.rev â‰¤ coheight (p i) := by
```
maybe?

```suggestion
lemma coheight_le_coheight_apply_of_strictMono (f : Î± â†’ Î²) (hf : StrictMono f) (x : Î±) :
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_eq_iSup_gt_coheight (x : Î±) : coheight x = â¨† y > x, coheight y + 1 :=
```

```suggestion
    n < coheight x â†” âˆƒ y > x, coheight y = n :=
```
(Personally, Iâ€™d be inclined to ban omitting parenthesis on the right of a symmetric operator when you cannot omit them on the left.)
